targets.rawSql:
SELECT  timestamp, count(distinct(deployment_name))
FROM kubernetes_deployment
where timestamp >= $__fromTime and timestamp <= $__toTime
SAMPLE BY $__sampleByInterval

SELECT  timestamp, node_count
FROM kubernetes_node
where timestamp >= $__fromTime and timestamp <= $__toTime
SAMPLE BY $__sampleByInterval

SELECT timestamp, count(distinct(namespace))
FROM kubernetes_pod_container
WHERE status = 'True'
and timestamp >= $__fromTime and timestamp <= $__toTime
SAMPLE BY $__sampleByInterval

SELECT timestamp, count(distinct(pod_name))
FROM kubernetes_pod_container
WHERE condition = 'Ready' and timestamp >= $__fromTime and timestamp <= $__toTime
SAMPLE BY $__sampleByInterval

SELECT (cast(first_not_null(kpd.cpu_usage_nanocores) as double) / 100000.0) / (cast(first_not_null(kn.capacity_cpu_cores) as double) * 100.0) as num, container_name as string
FROM kubernetes_pod_container kpd
JOIN kubernetes_node kn on kn.timestamp = kpd.timestamp
LATEST ON timestamp PARTITION BY container_name

SELECT memory_working_set_bytes, container_name as string
FROM kubernetes_pod_container
LATEST ON timestamp PARTITION BY container_name

SELECT
    timestamp,
    abs((rx_bytes - thing1) / ((cast(timestamp as double) - thing2)  / 100.0)) * 8 AS derivative
FROM (
  select
  timestamp, 
  rx_bytes,
  LAG(rx_bytes, 1) OVER (ORDER BY timestamp) as thing1,
  LAG(cast(timestamp as double), 1) OVER (ORDER BY timestamp) AS thing2
  FROM kubernetes_pod_network
  WHERE
    timestamp >= $__fromTime and timestamp <= $__toTime
  Sample by $__sampleByInterval
)
ORDER BY
    timestamp;

SELECT
    timestamp,
    abs((tx_bytes - thing1) / ((cast(timestamp as double) - thing2)  / 100.0)) * 8 AS derivative
FROM (
  select
  timestamp,
  tx_bytes,
  LAG(tx_bytes, 1) OVER (ORDER BY timestamp) as thing1,
  LAG(cast(timestamp as double), 1) OVER (ORDER BY timestamp) AS thing2
  FROM kubernetes_pod_network
  WHERE
    timestamp >= $__fromTime and timestamp <= $__toTime
  Sample by $__sampleByInterval
)
ORDER BY
    timestamp;

select startdate * 1000
from x509_cert
where common_name = 'oxn.sh'

select (age * 1.0) / (expiry)
from x509_cert
where common_name = 'oxn.sh' and timestamp >= $__fromTime and timestamp <= $__toTime
SAMPLE BY $__sampleByInterval

select enddate * 1000
from x509_cert
where common_name = 'oxn.sh'

SELECT uptime 
FROM system
where host = 'exodus' 
latest on timestamp partition by uptime

SELECT available_percent
FROM mem
where host = 'exodus'

SELECT fs_used_bytes 
FROM kubernetes_node
WHERE host = 'exodus' and timestamp >= $__fromTime and timestamp <= $__toTime
SAMPLE BY $__sampleByInterval

SELECT fs_available_bytes 
FROM kubernetes_node
where host = 'exodus' and timestamp >= $__fromTime and timestamp <= $__toTime
SAMPLE BY $__sampleByInterval

SELECT (cast(last_not_null(cpu_usage_nanocores) as double) / 100000.0) / (cast(last_not_null(capacity_cpu_cores) as double) * 100.0)
FROM kubernetes_node
where host = 'exodus' and timestamp >= $__fromTime and timestamp <= $__toTime
SAMPLE BY $__sampleByInterval

SELECT jitter 
FROM internet_speed
where host = 'exodus' 
latest on timestamp partition by jitter

SELECT download 
FROM internet_speed
where host = 'exodus' 
latest on timestamp partition by download

SELECT upload 
FROM internet_speed
WHERE host = 'exodus' 
latest on timestamp partition by upload

SELECT latency 
FROM internet_speed
WHERE host = 'exodus' 
latest on timestamp partition by latency

SELECT timestamp, download 
FROM internet_speed
WHERE host = 'exodus' and timestamp >= $__fromTime and timestamp <= $__toTime
SAMPLE BY $__sampleByInterval

SELECT timestamp, upload 
FROM internet_speed
WHERE host = 'exodus' and timestamp >= $__fromTime and timestamp <= $__toTime
SAMPLE BY $__sampleByInterval

SELECT timestamp, feature, temp_input 
FROM sensors
WHERE host = 'exodus' and chip = 'coretemp-isa-0000' and feature != 'package_id_0'  and timestamp >= $__fromTime and timestamp <= $__toTime
SAMPLE BY $__sampleByInterval

SELECT temp_input 
FROM sensors
WHERE host = 'exodus' and chip ilike 'nvme%' and feature = 'sensor_2' and timestamp >= $__fromTime and timestamp <= $__toTime
SAMPLE BY $__sampleByInterval

SELECT temp_input 
FROM sensors
WHERE host = 'exodus' and chip = 'iwlwifi_1-virtual-0' and feature = 'temp1' and timestamp >= $__fromTime and timestamp <= $__toTime
SAMPLE BY $__sampleByInterval

SELECT temp_input 
FROM sensors
WHERE host = 'exodus' and chip = 'coretemp-isa-0000' and feature = 'package_id_0' and timestamp >= $__fromTime and timestamp <= $__toTime
SAMPLE BY $__sampleByInterval

SELECT timestamp, (cast(first_not_null(cpu_usage_nanocores) as double) / 100000.0) / (cast(first_not_null(capacity_cpu_cores) as double) * 100.0) as num
FROM kubernetes_node
WHERE host = 'exodus' and timestamp >= $__fromTime and timestamp <= $__toTime
SAMPLE BY $__sampleByInterval

SELECT timestamp, memory_working_set_bytes 
FROM kubernetes_node
WHERE host = 'exodus' and timestamp >= $__fromTime and timestamp <= $__toTime
SAMPLE BY $__sampleByInterval

targets.query:
from(bucket: "homeassistant")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop:v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) =>
    r._measurement == "W" and
    r._field == "value"
  )
  |> aggregateWindow(every: 1m, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)

from(bucket: "homeassistant")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop:v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) =>
    r._measurement == "W" and
    r._field == "value"
  )
  |> aggregateWindow(every: 1m, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
